info.description: AWS AppSync provides API actions for creating and interacting with data sources using GraphQL from your application.
info.title: AWS AppSync

get.description:
Lists the API keys for a given API.

API keys are deleted automatically sometime after they expire. However, they may still be included in the response until they have actually been deleted. You can safely call DeleteApiKey to manually delete a key before it's automatically deleted.

post.description: Creates a unique key that you can distribute to clients who are executing your API.

get.description: Lists the data sources for a given API.

post.description:
Creates a Function object.

A function is a reusable entity. Multiple functions can be used to compose the resolver logic.

get.description: List the resolvers that are associated with a specific function.
Retrieves the introspection schema for a GraphQL API.
Retrieves the current status of a schema creation operation.

post.description:
Adds a new schema to your GraphQL API.

This operation is asynchronous. Use to determine when it has completed.

get.description: Lists the types for a given API.
Lists the resolvers for a given API and type.

post.description:
Creates a Resolver object.

A resolver converts incoming requests into a format that a data source can understand and converts the data source's responses into GraphQL.

ApiKey.description:
Describes an API key.

Customers invoke AWS AppSync GraphQL API operations with API keys as an identity mechanism. There are two key versions:

da1: This version was introduced at launch in November 2017. These keys always expire after 7 days. Key expiration is managed by Amazon DynamoDB TTL. The keys ceased to be valid after February 21, 2018 and should not be used after that date.

  • ListApiKeys returns the expiration time in milliseconds.

  • CreateApiKey returns the expiration time in milliseconds.

  • UpdateApiKey is not available for this key version.

  • DeleteApiKey deletes the item from the table.

  • Expiration is stored in Amazon DynamoDB as milliseconds. This results in a bug where keys are not automatically deleted because DynamoDB expects the TTL to be stored in seconds. As a one-time action, we will delete these keys from the table after February 21, 2018.

da2: This version was introduced in February 2018 when AppSync added support to extend key expiration.

  • ListApiKeys returns the expiration time in seconds.

  • CreateApiKey returns the expiration time in seconds and accepts a user-provided expiration time in seconds.

  • UpdateApiKey returns the expiration time in seconds and accepts a user-provided expiration time in seconds. Key expiration can only be updated while the key has not expired.

  • DeleteApiKey deletes the item from the table.

  • Expiration is stored in Amazon DynamoDB as seconds.

description.description: A description of the purpose of the API key.

expires.description: The time after which the API key expires. The date is represented as seconds since the epoch, rounded down to the nearest hour.

AuthorizationConfig.description: The authorization config in case the HTTP endpoint requires authorization.

authorizationType.description:
The authorization type required by the HTTP endpoint.

  • AWS_IAM: The authorization type is Sigv4.

signingRegion.description: The signing region for AWS IAM authorization.

signingServiceName.description: The signing service name for AWS IAM authorization.

description.description: A description of the purpose of the API key.

expires.description: The time from creation time after which the API key expires. The date is represented as seconds since the epoch, rounded down to the nearest hour. The default value for this parameter is 7 days from creation time. For more information, see .

serviceRoleArn.description: The AWS IAM service role ARN for the data source. The system assumes this role when accessing the data source.

functionVersion.description: The version of the request mapping template. Currently the supported value is 2018-05-29.

name.description: The Function name. The function name does not have to be unique.

requestMappingTemplate.description: The Function request mapping template. Functions support only the 2018-05-29 version of the request mapping template.

authenticationType.description: The authentication type: API key, AWS IAM, or Amazon Cognito user pools.

userPoolConfig.description: The Amazon Cognito user pool configuration.

dataSourceName.description: The name of the data source for which the resolver is being created.

fieldName.description: The name of the field to attach the resolver to.

kind.description:
The resolver type.

  • UNIT: A UNIT resolver type. A UNIT resolver is the default resolver type. A UNIT resolver enables you to execute a GraphQL query against a single data source.

  • PIPELINE: A PIPELINE resolver type. A PIPELINE resolver enables you to execute a series of Function in a serial manner. You can use a pipeline resolver to execute a GraphQL query against multiple data sources.

requestMappingTemplate.description:
The mapping template to be used for requests.

A resolver uses a request mapping template to convert a GraphQL expression into a format that a data source can understand. Mapping templates are written in Apache Velocity Template Language (VTL).

responseMappingTemplate.description: The mapping template to be used for responses from the data source.

definition.description:
The type definition, in GraphQL Schema Definition Language (SDL) format.

For more information, see the GraphQL SDL documentation.

format.description: The type format: SDL or JSON.

description.description: The description of the data source.

name.description: The name of the data source.

serviceRoleArn.description: The AWS IAM service role ARN for the data source. The system assumes this role when accessing the data source.

type.description:
The type of the data source.

  • AMAZON_DYNAMODB: The data source is an Amazon DynamoDB table.

  • AMAZON_ELASTICSEARCH: The data source is an Amazon Elasticsearch Service domain.

  • AWS_LAMBDA: The data source is an AWS Lambda function.

  • NONE: There is no data source. This type is used when you wish to invoke a GraphQL operation without connecting to a data source, such as performing data transformation with resolvers or triggering a subscription to be invoked from a mutation.

  • HTTP: The data source is an HTTP endpoint.

  • RELATIONAL_DATABASE: The data source is a relational database.

DynamodbDataSourceConfig.description: Describes an Amazon DynamoDB data source configuration.

useCallerCredentials.description: Set to TRUE to use Amazon Cognito credentials with this data source.

ElasticsearchDataSourceConfig.description: Describes an Elasticsearch data source configuration.

FunctionConfiguration.description: A function is a reusable entity. Multiple functions can be used to compose the resolver logic.

functionId.description: A unique ID representing the Function object.

functionVersion.description: The version of the request mapping template. Currently only the 2018-05-29 version of the template is supported.

requestMappingTemplate.description: The Function request mapping template. Functions support only the 2018-05-29 version of the request mapping template.

schema.description:
The schema, in GraphQL Schema Definition Language (SDL) format.

For more information, see the GraphQL SDL documentation.

details.description: Detailed information about the status of the schema creation operation.

status.description: The current state of the schema (PROCESSING, ACTIVE, or DELETING). Once the schema is in the ACTIVE state, you can add data.

userPoolConfig.description: The Amazon Cognito user pool configuration.

HttpDataSourceConfig.description: Describes an HTTP data source configuration.

authorizationConfig.description: The authorization config in case the HTTP endpoint requires authorization.

endpoint.description: The HTTP URL endpoint. You can either specify the domain name or IP, and port combination, and the URL scheme must be HTTP or HTTPS. If the port is not specified, AWS AppSync uses the default port 80 for the HTTP endpoint and port 443 for HTTPS endpoints.

LambdaDataSourceConfig.description: Describes an AWS Lambda data source configuration.

lambdaFunctionArn.description: The ARN for the Lambda function.

nextToken.description: An identifier to be passed in the next request to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier to be passed in the next request to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier to be passed in the next request to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier that can be used to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier to be passed in the next request to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.
An identifier to be passed in the next request to this operation to return the next set of items in the list.

cloudWatchLogsRoleArn.description: The service role that AWS AppSync will assume to publish to Amazon CloudWatch logs in your account.

fieldLogLevel.description:
The field logging level. Values can be NONE, ERROR, or ALL.

  • NONE: No field-level logs are captured.

  • ERROR: Logs the following information only for the fields that are in error:

    • The error section in the server response.

    • Field-level errors.

    • The generated request/response functions that got resolved for error fields.

  • ALL: The following information is logged for all fields in the query:

    • Field-level tracing information.

    • The generated request/response functions that got resolved for each field.

authTTL.description: The number of milliseconds a token is valid after being authenticated.

clientId.description: The client identifier of the Relying party at the OpenID identity provider. This identifier is typically obtained when the Relying party is registered with the OpenID identity provider. You can specify a regular expression so the AWS AppSync can validate against multiple client identifiers at a time.

iatTTL.description: The number of milliseconds a token is valid after being issued to a user.

issuer.description: The issuer for the OpenID Connect configuration. The issuer returned by discovery must exactly match the value of iss in the ID token.

PipelineConfig.description: The pipeline configuration for a resolver of kind PIPELINE.

RdsHttpEndpointConfig.description: The Amazon RDS HTTP endpoint configuration.

awsRegion.description: AWS Region for RDS HTTP endpoint.

awsSecretStoreArn.description: AWS secret store ARN for database credentials.

RelationalDatabaseDataSourceConfig.description: Describes a relational database data source configuration.

relationalDatabaseSourceType.description:
Source type for the relational database.

  • RDS_HTTP_ENDPOINT: The relational database source type is an Amazon RDS HTTP endpoint.

kind.description:
The resolver type.

  • UNIT: A UNIT resolver type. A UNIT resolver is the default resolver type. A UNIT resolver enables you to execute a GraphQL query against a single data source.

  • PIPELINE: A PIPELINE resolver type. A PIPELINE resolver enables you to execute a series of Function in a serial manner. You can use a pipeline resolver to execute a GraphQL query against multiple data sources.

definition.description: The schema definition, in GraphQL schema language format.

status.description: The current state of the schema (PROCESSING, ACTIVE, or DELETING). When the schema is in the ACTIVE state, you can add data.

format.description: The type format: SDL or JSON.

description.description: A description of the purpose of the API key.

expires.description: The time from update time after which the API key expires. The date is represented as seconds since the epoch. For more information, see .

description.description: The new description for the data source.

serviceRoleArn.description: The new service role ARN for the data source.

functionVersion.description: The version of the request mapping template. Currently the supported value is 2018-05-29.

requestMappingTemplate.description: The Function request mapping template. Functions support only the 2018-05-29 version of the request mapping template.

authenticationType.description: The new authentication type for the GraphqlApi object.

logConfig.description: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration for the GraphqlApi object.

name.description: The new name for the GraphqlApi object.

openIDConnectConfig.description: The OpenID Connect configuration for the GraphqlApi object.

userPoolConfig.description: The new Amazon Cognito user pool configuration for the GraphqlApi object.

kind.description:
The resolver type.

  • UNIT: A UNIT resolver type. A UNIT resolver is the default resolver type. A UNIT resolver enables you to execute a GraphQL query against a single data source.

  • PIPELINE: A PIPELINE resolver type. A PIPELINE resolver enables you to execute a series of Function in a serial manner. You can use a pipeline resolver to execute a GraphQL query against multiple data sources.

format.description: The new type format: SDL or JSON.

UserPoolConfig.description: Describes an Amazon Cognito user pool configuration.

appIdClientRegex.description: A regular expression for validating the incoming Amazon Cognito user pool app client ID.

awsRegion.description: The AWS Region in which the user pool was created.

defaultAction.description: The action that you want your GraphQL API to take when a request that uses Amazon Cognito user pool authentication doesn't match the Amazon Cognito user pool configuration.
